event.title: was filmed in Elgin, and the railroad scenes in the 1957

data.event: The train station sequence in the 1955 film classic Oklahoma!, with Gene Nelson singing and dancing the song "Kansas City" partly atop a moving train, was filmed in Elgin, and the railroad scenes in the 1957 western 3:10 to Yuma, with Glenn Ford and Van Heflin, were filmed in Elgin.

event.title: the 1970s, Gordon Dutt, Ph.D., a soil scientist from the University of Arizona, was intrigued

data.event: In the 1970s, Gordon Dutt, Ph.D., a soil scientist from the University of Arizona, was intrigued with the similarity between the soil of the Elgin-Sonoita area and that of Burgundy, France.
